etymologies: Old English īfig, of Germanic origin; related to the first elements of Dutch eiloof and German Efeu

definitions: a woody evergreen Eurasian climbing plant, typically having shiny, dark green five-pointed leaves.

notes.text: Genus Hedera, family Araliaceae: several species, in particular the common English ivy (H. helix), which is often seen climbing on tree trunks and walls

definitions: used in names of climbing plants similar to ivy, e.g. poison ivy, Boston ivy.
shortDefinitions: used in names of similar climbing plants

examples.text: many of the Ivies had been founded for the purpose of training students as ministers

definitions: a prestigious college or university of a specified region or type

examples.text: Duke is considered one of the “Southern Ivies”
one would think that seats at these public Ivies would be reserved for graduates of that state's high schools
